nodes.documentation:
@title Anchor contract which implements StateRootInterface.
 * @notice Anchor stores another chain's state roots. It stores the address of
        the co-anchor, which will be the anchor on the other chain. State
        roots are exchanged bidirectionally between the anchor and the
        co-anchor by the organization.
nodes.name: Anchor

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Remote chain Id must not be 0."

arguments.value: Remote chain Id must not be 0.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Remote chain Id must not be 0."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Co-Anchor has already been set and cannot be updated."

arguments.value: Co-Anchor has already been set and cannot be updated.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Co-Anchor has already been set and cannot be updated."

nodes.name: setCoAnchorAddress
getStateRoot

nodes.documentation:
@notice Gets the block height of latest anchored state root.
     * @return uint256 Block height of the latest anchored state root.
nodes.name: getLatestStateRootBlockHeight

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "State root must not be zero."

arguments.value: State root must not be zero.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "State root must not be zero."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Given block height is lower or equal to highest anchored state root block height."

arguments.value: Given block height is lower or equal to highest anchored state root block height.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Given block height is lower or equal to highest anchored state root block height."

nodes.documentation:
@notice External function anchorStateRoot.
     *  @dev anchorStateRoot Called from game process.
      Anchor new state root for a block height.
     *  @param _blockHeight Block height for which stateRoots mapping needs to
                     update.
 @param _stateRoot State root of input block height.
     *  @return bytes32 stateRoot
nodes.name: anchorStateRoot

nodes.documentation:
@notice Get the remote chain id of this anchor.
     *  @return remoteChainId_ The remote chain id.
nodes.name: getRemoteChainId

nodes.documentation:
@notice External function anchorStateRoot.
     *  @dev anchorStateRoot Called from game process.
      Anchor new state root for a block height.
     *  @param _blockHeight Block height for which stateRoots mapping needs to
                     update.
 @param _stateRoot State root of input block height.
     *  @return bytes32 stateRoot
nodes.name: anchorStateRoot

nodes.documentation:
@notice Get the remote chain id of this anchor.
     *  @return remoteChainId_ The remote chain id.
nodes.name: getRemoteChainId

anchorStateRoot(uint256,bytes32).details: anchorStateRoot Called from game process.      Anchor new state root for a block height.

params._blockHeight: Block height for which stateRoots mapping needs to                     update.
params._stateRoot: State root of input block height.

params._blockHeight: Block height at which _stateRoot needs to store.
params._maxStateRoots: The max number of state roots to store in the                      circular buffer.
params._remoteChainId: The chain id of the chain that is tracked by this                      anchor.

getLatestStateRootBlockHeight().return: uint256 Block height of the latest anchored state root.

params._blockHeight: The block height for which the state root is needed.

getStateRoot(uint256).return: bytes32 State root of the given height.

params._coAnchor: Address of the Co-Anchor on auxiliary.

getLatestStateRootBlockHeight().notice: Gets the block height of latest anchored state root.

getRemoteChainId().notice: Get the remote chain id of this anchor.

getStateRoot(uint256).notice: Get the state root for the given block height.

setCoAnchorAddress(address).notice: The Co-Anchor address is the address of the anchor that is         deployed on the other (origin/auxiliary) chain.

userdoc.notice: Anchor stores another chain's state roots. It stores the address of        the co-anchor, which will be the anchor on the other chain. State        roots are exchanged bidirectionally between the anchor and the        co-anchor by the organization.
